standup-live.title: Standup Live
standup-live.description: Paid live streaming platform for a concert with access payments and content protection
standup-live.about: For standup show organizers, we built a paid online streaming platform. Viewers purchase access, log in, and watch the concert in real time through a secure video player. A recording is available after the broadcast.
standup-live.challenge: The organizers needed their own streaming platform where viewers pay for access to a live broadcast. It was critical to protect content from recording and unauthorized distribution, support promo codes, and handle traffic under load.
standup-live.solution: A web application with Supabase authentication, MAIB payments, live streaming via Castr (HLS), a secure video player with watermark, countdown timer before the show, promo codes, and post-broadcast recording access. An admin panel for managing streams and users.
standup-live.result: A successful online concert broadcast with hundreds of paying viewers. Content protection prevented piracy. Promo codes and a free access system supported marketing efforts. The platform ran smoothly throughout the entire broadcast.

povestea-de-iarna.title: Povestea de Iarnă
povestea-de-iarna.description: Ticketing system for a 1,700-seat winter show with venue map, payments, and access control
povestea-de-iarna.about: Povestea de Iarnă is a large-scale winter show for which we built a digital ticketing system. A 1,700-seat venue required a precise seating map with zones and rows, a smooth purchasing flow, and reliable QR-based access control at the gates.
povestea-de-iarna.challenge: The organizers needed their own ticketing platform without third-party commissions. A 1,700-seat hall with multiple pricing zones required a clear visual map for seat selection, instant payment processing, and automated ticket delivery.
povestea-de-iarna.solution: We built a web platform with a detailed SVG venue layout, a streamlined ticket purchase flow, MAIB card payment integration, instant PDF ticket generation with QR codes and email delivery. The admin panel includes sales analytics and zone-based pricing controls.
povestea-de-iarna.result: Organizers gained full control over ticket sales with no intermediaries. Attendees pick seats and receive tickets in seconds. QR verification at the entrance ensured fast and secure admission. Real-time analytics enabled flexible pricing and capacity management.

voievod.title: Voievod
voievod.description: Ticket sales platform with interactive arena map, online payments, and QR scanning
voievod.about: Voievod is a rock opera choreographic show at Arena Chișinău. The event needed a full-featured ticket sales platform with seat selection on an interactive map, online payments, PDF ticket generation with QR codes, and a scanning system at the entrance.
voievod.challenge: A large-scale arena show required a system that lets viewers pick specific seats across 16 zones, pay online, and receive tickets instantly. An admin panel with sales analytics, pricing management, and ticket verification at the gate was essential.
voievod.solution: A web application with an interactive SVG arena map (zoom/pan, real-time seat statuses), MAIB payment integration, auto-generated PDF tickets with QR codes, email delivery, Telegram notifications, and a full admin panel with dashboard, zone analytics, VIP invitation management, and refunds.
voievod.result: A fully autonomous platform: viewers select seats, pay, and receive tickets without operator involvement. QR scanning at the entrance eliminates counterfeits. The admin panel with sales charts and zone analytics gave organizers complete control over the event.

egotax.title: EgoTax
egotax.description: B2B platform for an accounting company with online calculator, payments, and admin panel
egotax.about: EgoTax is an accounting company from Moldova with 7+ years of experience and 500+ clients. They needed a digital platform that automates service cost calculations, accepts online payments, and manages requests through an admin panel with real-time analytics.
egotax.challenge: The company handled all inquiries and calculations manually — via phone calls and spreadsheets. Clients couldn't quickly estimate service costs, and payments were only accepted in cash or by bank transfer. A full-featured digital platform was needed.
egotax.solution: A web application with an advanced cost calculator (7 business forms, 9 activity types, 40+ parameters), online payments via MAIB, and an admin panel with transaction management, refunds, dynamic pricing, and user roles. Telegram and email notifications for instant response.
egotax.result: A fully automated cycle from cost estimation to payment. Clients independently calculate costs and pay online. The admin panel with analytics and data export reduced request processing time and increased the conversion rate from inquiries to payments.

lineproduction.title: Line Production
lineproduction.description: Corporate website for a video production studio from Moldova
lineproduction.about: Line Production is one of Moldova's leading video production companies, working with major brands like Moldcell, MICB, and Ultra. They needed a website that matches the cinematic quality of their work — bold, dynamic, and visually striking. We created a dark-themed experience with smooth animations, an interactive portfolio carousel, and full-bleed video integration that immerses visitors from the first second.
lineproduction.challenge: The old website didn't convey the scale and professionalism of the studio. Line Production needed a digital presence that reflects the cinematic quality of their video work — something dynamic, memorable, and visually powerful.
lineproduction.solution: A dark-themed website with bold typography, smooth scroll-driven animations, and an interactive project carousel. The design puts video front and center with full-bleed imagery, autoplay sections, and seamless transitions between portfolio pieces.
lineproduction.result: A modern, high-impact website that effectively showcases the studio's portfolio, attracts new clients from Moldova's top brands, and positions Line Production as the country's leading video production company. The site became their primary sales tool, driving direct inquiries through an immersive browsing experience.

artgarage.title: Art Garage
artgarage.description: Corporate website for a full-cycle creative advertising agency from Moldova
artgarage.about: Art Garage is a creative advertising agency from Chișinău with over 10 years of experience, 500+ completed projects and its own production facility. They needed a modern website to showcase their full range of services — outdoor and interior advertising, POS materials, printing, installations, and 2D/3D design — and to attract new B2B clients.
artgarage.challenge: Art Garage had no website that reflected the scale of their capabilities. With 150+ clients including Kaufland, Moldinconbank, and Cricova, they needed a digital platform to present their portfolio, services, and expertise in a structured and professional way.
artgarage.solution: A bilingual website (RO/RU) with a service catalog, filterable portfolio with 100+ works across 12 categories, interactive design section, FAQ, and a streamlined contact flow. The dark theme with accent colors emphasizes the visual nature of their work.
artgarage.result: A professional digital presence that systematizes all services and projects in one place, simplifies client inquiries with structured service pages, and strengthens Art Garage's position as a leading full-cycle advertising agency in Moldova.

cong-2025.title: National Oncology Congress
cong-2025.description: Official website for the 6th National Oncology Congress of Moldova with online registration and bilingual support
cong-2025.about: The 6th National Oncology Congress is the largest professional medical event in Moldova, bringing together oncologists, surgeons, radiologists, and healthcare specialists. The conference takes place October 9–10, 2025 at Radisson Blu Leogrand Hotel in Chișinău and grants participants 15 CME accreditation points.
cong-2025.challenge: The organizing committee needed a professional digital platform to inform attendees about the program, manage online registrations across four participant categories with tiered pricing, and present the event in both English and Romanian for international reach.
cong-2025.solution: A bilingual website (EN/RO) featuring a detailed scientific program covering 10+ oncology disciplines, a registration system with category-based pricing and early-bird discounts, interactive 3D elements, sponsor showcase, and a clean medical-grade design that reflects the prestige of the event.
cong-2025.result: A centralized information hub that streamlines the registration process for doctors, students, nurses and non-members, clearly communicates the congress program and logistics, and elevates the event's digital presence on an international level.

examen.title: Examen Festival
examen.description: Website for an electronic music festival in Moldova featuring custom 3D animation and a built-in ticket sales system
examen.about: Examen is a conceptual electronic music festival in Moldova celebrating youth, courage and ambitions. The second edition (Summer 2024) needed a bold digital identity that matched the energy of the event — with immersive 3D visuals, festival branding, and a seamless path to purchase tickets.
examen.challenge: A standard event page wouldn't do justice to Examen's aesthetic. The team needed a site that felt like the festival itself — dark, immersive, and visually explosive — while also handling the practical side: ticket sales, lineup presentation, and social engagement.
examen.solution: A custom-built website with an animated 3D neon figure in the hero section, glitch-style typography, a scrolling marquee, an embedded aftermovie from the 2023 edition, and a dedicated ticket subdomain (tickets.examen.wtf). The dark aesthetic with neon pink accents captures the raw energy of the festival.
examen.result: A digital experience that matches the festival's identity — immersive and memorable — while driving ticket sales and building the Examen brand ahead of each new edition.

msprod.title: MS-PROD
msprod.description: Corporate website for a technical event production company with 15+ years of experience and 1100+ events delivered
msprod.about: MS-PROD is a professional technical production company based in Chișinău, specializing in comprehensive technical support for events of any scale — from corporate conferences to large-scale concerts. With 15+ years of experience, the company provides lighting, sound, stage structures, and engineering services backed by top-tier equipment from world-renowned brands.
msprod.challenge: MS-PROD needed a website that communicated the breadth and quality of their services to potential clients, showcased their impressive portfolio of major events, and made it easy to initiate a project inquiry — all while reflecting the bold, high-energy nature of the live events industry.
msprod.solution: We built a corporate website that positions MS-PROD as a premium partner rather than just a vendor. The design language was crafted to reflect the intensity of live production — authoritative, bold, and confident. A clear service breakdown helps clients quickly understand what they're getting, while the project portfolio with major artist names builds instant credibility. A transparent 6-step process section answers the key client question: what does working with you actually look like?
msprod.result: A professional online presence that clearly positions MS-PROD as a premium technical production partner, showcases their portfolio to high-profile clients, and drives project inquiries through clear CTAs and an authoritative brand image.

dj-voting.title: DJ Voting App
dj-voting.description: Real-time voting platform for DJ competitions with QR-code access, anti-fraud protection, and live results screens
dj-voting.about: A web application built for DJ events where the audience votes for their favorite DJs across two rounds. The platform handles the full competition flow — from QR-code-gated voting to live results displayed on screens — with anti-fraud measures and a full admin panel to control the process.
dj-voting.challenge: Live audience voting is notoriously easy to exploit. The client needed a system that felt fast and frictionless for guests scanning QR codes, while preventing duplicate votes, supporting two competition rounds, and giving the organizer full real-time control over the event flow.
dj-voting.solution: We built a Next.js app backed by Supabase with real-time subscriptions. Votes are protected by FingerprintJS to prevent duplicates without requiring accounts. Round 1 collects votes from all DJs, then the top two advance to Round 2. Separate results screens update live for the audience, while the admin panel lets organizers start/stop rounds, reset data, and monitor progress in real time.
dj-voting.result: A smooth, fraud-resistant voting experience that kept the audience engaged throughout the event. The organizer had full control from the admin panel, and the live results screens created a genuinely exciting moment when the winner was revealed.

epc.title: EPC Summit Moldova
epc.description: Frontend development of the official website for the 2nd European Political Community Summit at Castel Mimi
epc.about: The European Political Community (EPC) Summit is a pan-European political platform bringing together leaders from 47 countries. Moldova hosted the second summit on June 1, 2023 at the historic Castel Mimi winery — one of the most significant political events in the country's history.
epc.challenge: The project required frontend development under tight deadlines for a high-profile international event. The website needed to convey diplomatic gravitas, work flawlessly across all devices, and handle heavy media content — all while meeting the visual standards of a state-level event.
epc.solution: We developed the full frontend: responsive layouts for the summit program, About Moldova, Castel Mimi history, news hub, video gallery, and registration pages. Custom animations, optimized responsive images for all breakpoints, and polished UI components ensured a premium feel that matched the scale of the event.
epc.result: A performant, fully responsive event portal that supported 47 participating nations, handled media and registration flows seamlessly, and contributed to elevating Moldova's international image during a landmark European summit.

BlogPost_sozdanie-lendinga-Moldova-polno.title: Building a Landing Page in Moldova: An Honest Guide
BlogPost_sozdanie-lendinga-Moldova-polno.intro: If you've been thinking about creating a landing page for your business in Moldova — you're probably already tired of cookie-cutter answers like 'a landing page is a one-page website that sells.' Thanks, we already know that. Let's get into what actually matters, with real examples and zero marketing fluff.

why.title: Why you need a landing page when you already have Instagram
why.content:
Honestly? Instagram is fine. But it has one major downside: you don't control the funnel. Someone opens your profile, scrolls a bit, sees their friend's cat — and leaves.

A landing page is your turf. Here, you guide the customer by hand: from the headline to the 'Submit' button. No distractions, no recommendation feeds.

At GoQode, we work with businesses in Chișinău and Moldova and see the same story: a company spends €500–1,000/month on Facebook ads driving traffic to their Instagram profile. Conversion: 1–2%. The same traffic to a proper landing page delivers 5–8%. The math is simple.

structure.title: Landing page structure that actually works
structure.content: Forget about '12 mandatory landing page blocks' from 2018 articles. Structure depends on your product and audience. But some things work almost every time:
list: First screen — a concrete offer. Not 'best solutions for your business,' but 'Water delivery in Chișinău in 40 minutes. First bottle free.' A person needs to understand what you offer within 3 seconds.
Social proof near the offer. Not at the bottom of the page where nobody sees it, but right under the headline. '150+ clients in Chișinău' or real company logos.
One target action. Not 'call us / write on WhatsApp / submit a request / subscribe.' One button. One goal.
A 'how it works' block with 3–4 steps. People fear the unknown. Show that the process is simple.
Real case studies or reviews. Not 'John D., director.' Concrete results.

mistakes.title: 5 mistakes that kill landing page conversion
mistakes.content: Over 30+ projects, we've seen it all. Here's what's guaranteed to ruin your results:

items.subtitle: Free Tilda template
items.text: No, Tilda isn't evil. But when a car repair shop owner in Chișinău takes a fitness club template and just swaps the text — it doesn't work. The template doesn't account for your audience, your product, your funnel.

items.subtitle: Load speed > 3 seconds
items.text: Mobile internet in Moldova is decent, but not everywhere. If your landing page takes 5 seconds to load because of unoptimized images — 53% of visitors will simply close the tab.

items.subtitle: A form with 10 fields
items.text: Name, phone, email, company, position, budget... Stop. For the first contact, name and phone are enough. Every extra field reduces conversion by 10–15%.

items.subtitle: No mobile version (yes, in 2026)
items.text: 70% of traffic in Moldova is mobile. If your landing page isn't mobile-friendly — you're losing 7 out of 10 potential customers.

items.subtitle: Text about nothing
items.text: 'We are a dynamically developing company with an individual approach.' This literally means nothing. Write specifically: what you do, for whom, what result.

cost.title: How much does a landing page cost in Moldova
cost.content:
Let's be upfront. The Chișinău market varies:

— Freelancer on 999.md: €100–300. You'll get a template with your text.

— Mid-level web studio: €500–1,500. Decent design, responsive layout, basic SEO.

— Professional development (what we do): €690–2,000. Custom design, conversion-optimized structure, speed optimization, analytics, A/B testing.

The real question isn't 'how much does a landing page cost,' but 'how much will it earn you.' A €200 page with 1% conversion vs a €1,000 page with 5% — the difference isn't €800, it's dozens of customers every month.

seo.title: SEO for landing pages: does it make sense?
seo.content:
Short answer — yes, with nuances.

A landing page is one page. It won't rank for 500 keywords. But for 5–10 targeted queries — absolutely.

For businesses in Moldova, this is especially relevant: Google competition for Romanian and Russian queries is several times lower than in Romania or Russia.

tech.title: What to build your landing page with: builders vs custom dev
tech.content:
Tilda, Wix, WordPress — all have their pros. But here's the objective reality:

Builders work if:
— You need a landing page 'yesterday' to test an idea
— Budget is under €200

Professional development is needed if:
— You spend €300+/month on ads and every conversion percent matters
— You need unique animations, non-standard structure
— Page speed matters
— You need CRM, messenger, or payment integrations

checklist.title: Pre-launch checklist
list: Landing page loads in < 3 seconds on mobile
The form works and submissions arrive (test it yourself!)
The text makes sense to someone seeing your business for the first time
Everything is tappable, readable, and scrollable on mobile
Analytics installed: Google Analytics, Facebook Pixel
Thank you page exists after form submission
Contact info is up to date
Meta tags are filled in (title, description)

conclusion.title: Bottom line
conclusion.content:
Building a landing page isn't magic. It's concrete work: audience research, proper structure, clear copy, fast loading, and ongoing optimization.

If you're in Moldova and thinking about a landing page for your business — we're always happy to chat. No hard sell, just a conversation about what will actually work for your case.

meta.title: How Much Does a Website Cost in Moldova in 2026 — Prices, Timelines, Details
meta.description: Real prices for website development in Moldova: landing pages, corporate sites, online stores. Freelancer vs studio comparison, hidden costs, and tips to save without losing quality.

BlogPost_skolko-stoit-sait-v-Moldova-202.title: How Much Does a Website Cost in Moldova in 2026
BlogPost_skolko-stoit-sait-v-Moldova-202.intro: "How much does a website cost?" — we hear this question every week. And every time the answer is the same: it depends on the task. Sounds like an excuse, but it's true. The difference between a €500 landing page and a €5,000 online store is like between renovating a bathroom and building a house. In this article, we'll break it all down: what types of websites exist, how much development really costs in Moldova, what affects the price, and how not to overpay.

types.title: Types of Websites and Their Cost in Moldova
types.content: Before talking about prices, let's figure out what kind of website you need. This is the first thing that determines the budget.

0.subtitle: Landing Page (single-page website)
0.text: One page with a clear goal — sell a service, collect leads, present a product. Development time: 1–3 weeks. Cost in Moldova: €300–1,500. A simple template-based landing page costs €300–500. Custom design with animations and CRM integration — €800–1,500.

1.subtitle: Corporate Website
1.text: Multi-page company website: about us, services, portfolio, contacts, blog. Timeline: 3–6 weeks. Cost: €800–3,000. Depends on the number of pages, design complexity, and whether an admin panel is needed.

2.subtitle: Online Store
2.text: Product catalog, cart, checkout, personal account, payment and delivery system integration. Timeline: 4–10 weeks. Cost: €1,500–5,000. The main price variation comes from the number of products, integrations, and features. A store with 50 products and one with 5,000 are different projects.

3.subtitle: Web Application
3.text: CRM, SaaS platform, booking service, personal dashboard with business logic. Timeline: 2–6 months. Cost: €3,000–15,000+. Everything here is individual. Each project is like a new product that needs to be designed, developed, and tested.

factors.title: What Affects the Price of a Website
factors.content: The cost isn't a random number. Behind every figure are specific hours of work by designers, developers, and project managers. Here are the main factors:

list.0: Design complexity — template solution or custom UI/UX with prototyping. The difference can be 2–3x
list.1: Number of pages and content types — each unique page template is separate design and development work
list.2: Functionality — a contact form costs €50, while an online payment system with integration costs €500+
list.3: Responsiveness — the site must look good on phones, tablets, and desktops. This isn't a bonus, it's a mandatory part of development
list.4: CMS and platform — WordPress is cheaper to launch but more expensive to maintain. Custom development is the opposite
list.5: Content — texts, photos, videos. If you don't have ready content, you'll need a copywriter and photographer
list.6: Integrations — CRM, payment systems, email services, analytics. Each integration is a separate task
list.7: SEO optimization — the technical foundation for search engine visibility. Without it, your site simply won't be found

comparison.title: Freelancer, Studio, or Website Builder: What to Choose
comparison.content: The same website can be ordered from a freelancer, a studio, or built yourself with a website builder. The results will differ.

0.subtitle: Website Builder (Wix, Tilda, Squarespace)
0.text: Cost: €0–200 + subscription €10–30/month. Suitable for: business cards, simple landing pages, testing an idea. Pros — fast and cheap. Cons — limited design, SEO problems, platform dependency. As your business grows, the builder quickly becomes too restrictive.

1.subtitle: Freelancer
1.text: Cost: €200–2,000. Suitable for: landing pages, small sites with clear specifications. Pros — cheaper than a studio, flexible schedule. Cons — one person can't be a designer, developer, and marketer at the same time. Risk: if the freelancer disappears — the project stalls.

2.subtitle: Web Studio
2.text: Cost: €500–5,000+. Suitable for: any projects, especially when deadlines and quality matter. Pros — team of specialists, guarantees, post-launch support. Cons — more expensive than a freelancer. But the price is justified: you pay for the process, not just the code.

3.subtitle: In-house Team
3.text: Cost: from €2,000/month in salaries. Suitable for: large companies with constant development needs. Pros — full control, fast iterations. Cons — expensive, hard to find good specialists in Moldova.

hidden.title: Hidden Costs People Forget About
hidden.content: A website isn't a one-time purchase. After launch, regular expenses begin that need to be included in the budget:

list.0: Domain — €10–15 per year. Your website's address on the internet. A simple name in the .md zone starts from €10
list.1: Hosting — €3–50 per month. Depends on traffic and site type. An online store requires more resources than a business card site
list.2: SSL certificate — €0–50 per year. Data protection and the lock icon in the browser. Many hosts offer free Let's Encrypt
list.3: Technical support — €50–200 per month. Updates, bug fixes, uptime monitoring. You don't have to pay constantly — you can request help as needed
list.4: Content updates — €0–500 per month. New products, articles, promotions. If you have a CMS — you can do it yourself
list.5: SEO promotion — €200–1,000 per month. Without promotion, your site will be on page 10 of Google. This is separate, ongoing work

timeline.title: How Timelines Affect Cost
timeline.content:
"We need it yesterday" — the most expensive phrase in web development. Urgency increases the cost by 30–50%. And it's not about greed — to speed up the work, studios bring in additional specialists and restructure their schedules.

Realistic timelines for Moldova:
• Landing page — 1–3 weeks
• Corporate website — 3–6 weeks
• Online store — 4–10 weeks
• Web application — 2–6 months

Tip: start thinking about your website in advance. A project done without rush always turns out better and cheaper. The team has time to think through every detail instead of patching holes on the fly.

save.title: How to Save Without Losing Quality
save.content: You can and should save on your website. But smartly. Here are proven methods:

list.0: Prepare a clear brief — the more precisely you describe the task, the fewer iterations and revisions. And revisions cost time and money
list.1: Provide content in advance — texts, photos, logos. When a studio waits for materials from the client, the project stalls and timelines grow
list.2: Start with MVP — launch the basic version and improve based on real data. It doesn't need to be perfect from day one
list.3: Choose modern technologies — Next.js, React, headless CMS. More expensive at the start, but cheaper in maintenance and scaling
list.4: Think long-term — a cheap website that needs to be redone in a year costs more than a quality website from the start
list.5: Cut the extras — 80% of features aren't used at launch. Focus on what matters, add the rest later

checklist.title: Checklist Before Ordering a Website
checklist.content: Before contacting a studio or freelancer, prepare answers to these questions:

list.0: What is the website's goal? Sales, leads, brand image, information?
list.1: Who is your target audience? Age, interests, how will they find your site
list.2: Which competitor websites do you like and why specifically?
list.3: Do you have ready content — texts, photos, logo?
list.4: What budget are you willing to allocate? It's better to state the range upfront
list.6: What languages will the site be in?
list.7: What integrations are needed — CRM, analytics, payment systems?

conclusion.title: Summary
conclusion.content: The cost of a website in Moldova in 2026 ranges from €300 for a simple landing page to €15,000+ for a complex web application. The most important thing is not to chase the cheapest option and not to overpay for unnecessary features. Define your goal, prepare your materials, and choose a partner you trust.

meta.title: 5 Signs Your Website Needs a Redesign — GoQode
meta.description: How to tell your website is outdated: slow loading, non-responsive design, low conversion. A checklist for businesses in Moldova.

BlogPost_5-priznakov-chto-sajtu-nuzhen-r.title: 5 Signs Your Website Needs a Redesign
BlogPost_5-priznakov-chto-sajtu-nuzhen-r.intro: A website isn't a "set it and forget it" thing. Technologies change, user expectations grow, and Google regularly updates its algorithms. If you haven't updated your site in 2–3 years, it's probably already working against you. Here are five signals it's time to act.

signs.title: Signs Your Website Is Outdated
signs.content: Check your site against these points. If at least two match — it's time to think about a redesign.

0.subtitle: Your site looks bad on mobile
0.text: Over 70% of traffic in Moldova is mobile. If your site isn't responsive, you're losing most visitors. Google also ranks mobile-friendly sites higher in search results.

1.subtitle: Pages take more than 3 seconds to load
1.text: Every extra second of loading time means minus 7% conversion. Old sites on heavy CMS platforms often take 5–8 seconds to load. Modern technologies solve this problem.

2.subtitle: The design looks like it's from 2018
2.text: Tiny fonts, cluttered elements, stock photos everywhere. Users subconsciously distrust outdated websites — if the site looks old, the business seems outdated too.

3.subtitle: Conversion is dropping or stagnant
3.text: Traffic exists, but leads don't. Often the problem isn't advertising — it's the site itself: confusing navigation, weak CTAs, missing trust elements. A UX-focused redesign can boost conversion 2–3x.

4.subtitle: The site is hard to update
4.text: To change text or add a product, you need to call the developer and wait a week. Modern CMS and headless solutions let businesses manage content themselves in minutes.

action.title: What to Do Next
action.content: A redesign isn't just about "making it prettier." It's an opportunity to rethink the structure, improve the user journey, and connect modern analytics tools. Start with an audit: check speed via Google PageSpeed, review user behavior in analytics, compare your site with competitors. If the picture is grim — it's time to call in the professionals.

conclusion.title: Summary
conclusion.content: An outdated website isn't just unattractive. It means lost customers, low Google rankings, and advertising money spent for nothing. The good news: a redesign doesn't have to be expensive or take months. Sometimes targeted improvements are enough to breathe new life into your site.
